notes: Sparse coverage corresponds to fewer than 5,000 valid observations per node.
Moderate coverage spans from 5,000 up to 20,000 observations; above that a node is dense.
Long gaps start once the maximum consecutive gap exceeds roughly 3.15 years (~1,150 days).
Extreme gaps reflect outages longer than 1,200 days (â‰ˆ3.29 years).
Thresholds reflect HF-EOLUS SAR range final analysis (audits dated 2025-10-21).
Adjust the numbers if reusing the taxonomy on datasets with different sampling cadence or duration.
